name: Aonyx cinereus
desc: A. Cinereus is the smallest otter in the world, weighing less than 5 kg. They live in salt marshes and freshwater wetlands

name: Pica pica
desc: Birds settled in Europe, much of Asia, northwest Africa. It is one of several species of birds in the family Corvidae with the common name magpie

name: Brown Dove
desc: The brown dove (Columba punicea) is a species of bird in the Columbidae family.

name: Clouded Leopard
desc: The Clouded Leopard is a medium-sized cat in the Cat Family, 60 to 110 cm (2' - 3'6) full-bodied and 11 - 20 kg (25 lbs 4oz - 44 lbs) in weight.

name: Asian Golden Cat
desc: The Asian Golden Cat is a medium-sized (90 cm long, plus a 50 cm tail) carnivore weighing 12 to 16 kg, mostly in the wild.

name: White-Handed Gibbon
desc: Nomenclature: Hylobates lar, is a primate of the apes family. This is considered one of the wisest apes and is often encountered in zoos.

name: Wolf fire
desc: The Indian wild dog (scientific name: Cuon alpinus) is a carnivore of the canidae family, the only member of the genus Cuon.

name: Border mountain turtle
desc: Mountain tortoises often live on land in crevices and valleys. This tortoise is one of the most beautiful tortoise species, with a golden brown shell and skin.

name: Green frog
desc: Its natural habitats are subtropical or tropical moist lowland forests and rivers. Its conservation status is currently inadequate.

name: Hippopus hippopus
desc: The 2007 Vietnam Red Book for these species is found in the Spratlys, with classification VU A1c, d.

name: Long-legged dragon
desc: The spiny lobster inhabits coral reefs and shallow rocks in the tropical and subtropical Indo-Pacific.

name: The red helmet
desc: a species of large sea snail, a marine gastropod mollusk in the family Cassidae.
